cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 435 miles SE of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest toward the South Carolina coast, expected to slow and come ashore near Charleston on Sunday, then drift north-northeast inland before re-emerging offshore early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central coast of South Carolina in the vicinity of Charleston

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Georgia coast, entire South Carolina coast, extending into southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (39–45 mph, gusts higher) likely Saturday night through Sunday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground level possible in and near Charleston Harbor, producing minor coastal flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, leading to brief freshwater flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor beach erosion.
